text: Simpson Conservation Park (formerly the Simpson Conservation Reserve) is a protected area in the Australian state of South Australia located in the locality of Porkys Flat on Dudley Peninsula on Kangaroo Island about south of Penneshaw. The conservation park was proclaimed under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1972 in 2010 over crown land previously dedicated as a conservation reserve in 1986. The conservation park is classified as an IUCN Category Ia protected area. ==References== ==External links== *Entry for Simpson Conservation Park on protected planet Category:Conservation parks of South Australia Category:Protected areas established in 1986 Category:1986 establishments in Australia Category:Protected areas of Kangaroo Island Category:Dudley Peninsula
title: Simpson Conservation Park
